problem_text:
18.82. Is there a function f : N →N such that for any prime p, if pf(n) divides the order of a finite group G, then pn divides the order of Aut G?
R. M. Patne
answer: Yes, there is. This was established in (J. A. Green, Proc. Roy. Soc. London Ser. A., 237 (1956), 574–581), which improved a previous result with a function depending on p in (W. Ledermann, B. H. Neumann, Proc. Roy. Soc. London. Ser. A, 235 (1956), 235–246).
